full_threads.body:
Hi Alyssa,

Thanks so much for following up!

I have great news - I can confirm that all the approved updates on this thread have now been successfully pushed to the live site.

You can review the changes here:
  • Contact Us: https://www.oncobeta.com.au/contact-us/
  • Find a Treatment Centre: https://www.oncobeta.com.au/find-a-treatment-centre/
  • Newsletter Form: (Visible sitewide above the footer)

This deployment includes the new Canopy NZ location, the scroll & auto-fill behavior on the buttons, and the custom styling we discussed.

Everything should be looking sharp! Let me know if you need anything else. Always happy to help!
Will forward to client

Done manually transferring the change to live site including the canopy NZ updates and new custom CSS styles.

https://www.oncobeta.com.au/contact-us/
https://www.oncobeta.com.au/find-a-treatment-centre/
Newsletter form (sitewide)

(time:160min)
-Whil

WolfIQ Support, 5 Jan 2026, 14:50 GMT+11

Hi Jenn,

Thanks for the detailed feedback!

I have gone ahead and actioned most of these points for you immediately (removing the duplicate asterisks, sorting the list alphabetically, and making the message field non-mandatory).

Regarding your question about the **Dynamic Location Input** and the time estimate, I wanted to clarify a couple of technical details for you:
**1. "Is the dropdown dynamic?"** Currently, the location cards on the page are built using individual text widgets rather than a central database or table. Because of this, the form cannot automatically "read" or pick up new locations when you add a card to the design. We will simply need to add the new location to the dropdown list manually whenever a new clinic is added - just as we are doing now with the Hawkes Bay location.

**2. Scroll Down & Auto-fill Behaviour** I can definitely set up the "Enquire" buttons so that they not only scroll down to the form but also **automatically pre-select** the correct clinic in the dropdown for the user.

However, as this requires some custom coding to link the specific buttons to the form fields, it falls slightly outside the original scope. I estimate this will require an **additional 30 minutes** on top of the current 4.5-hour estimate.

Are you happy for me to proceed with that additional time to get the auto-select feature working smoothly?



Warmly,
**Adriane Roa**
support@wolfiq.com.au

Please apply the **SCROLL DOWN BEHAVIOUR** and the dynamic location input.

>

WolfIQ Support, 5 Jan 2026, 10:04 GMT+11

Hi Jenn,

Happy New Year - I hope you had a great holiday season!

Circling back on this - thanks so much for the detailed feedback! I’ve gone through your notes and have ticked off the following updates for you:
**Subscribe to our Newsletter Form**

- **Opt-out Field:** The marketing opt-out checkbox is now **non-mandatory**, so users can freely leave it unticked if they prefer.
- **Conditional Logic:** The "Please specify" field is now correctly set to **mandatory** whenever "Other" is selected for the "Are you a Patient..." question.
- **State Field:** The Australian State dropdown has been added.

**Find a Treatment Location Page**

- **Clinic Logic:** The "Please specify" field is now **mandatory** if "Other" is selected in the Clinic dropdown.
- **Patient Logic:** Similarly, the "Please specify" field is now **mandatory** if "Other" is selected for the "Are you a Patient..." question.

Just for your records, these changes took about 15 minutes. All good now!

**Quick Clarification: Enquire Button Functionality** I noticed two slightly different directions regarding the "Enquire" buttons, and you asked me to advise on what is possible.

1. **Pop-up Modal:** You asked if it is possible to open the form in a pop-up modal. **Yes, this is definitely possible.**
2. **Scroll Down:** The "Important Note" mentioned keeping the form visible on the page and having the button simply **scroll the user down** to it.

Since both options are achievable, **could you let me know if you prefer the Pop-up or the Scroll-down behavior?**

If there is anything else, happy to help!



Warmly,
**Adriane Roa**

WolfIQ Support, 12 Dec 2025, 14:39 GMT+11

Hi Jenn,

Thanks for the detailed brief - very clear and helpful.

We’ve reviewed the new set of requested updates. Please see below for the time estimates for each task so you can share them with the client for approval.

**Global Form Updates (applies to all forms)**

- Add State dropdown (AU states & territories)
- Add Privacy Collection Notice text
- Add marketing opt-out checkbox
**Estimate:** **~30 mins** (applied once globally, not per form)


### **1. Contact Us Form Updates**

- Remove direct email address + phone number from left column
- Remove AHPRA ID/Number
- Add required “Are you a?” dropdown with conditional “Other – please specify”
- Add “Are you enquiring about?” dropdown
**Estimate:** **~45 mins**


### **2. Subscribe to Our Newsletter Form**

- Remove Organisation, City, Postcode, Phone Number
- Make “Are you a patient?” compulsory
- Add “Other” option with conditional “Please specify”
**Estimate:** **~30 mins**


### **3. Find a Treatment Location – Enquiry Form**

- Update heading text
- Configure form to open in a modal when clicking “Enquiry now” (feasibility depends on theme/plugin; if unsupported, we’ll advise alternatives)
- Add "Clinic enquiring about" dropdown with conditional “Other”
- Add mandatory “Are you a patient?” with “Other” + conditional field
**Estimate:** **~1 hr**


### **4. Footer Update**

- Remove email address and retain phone number
**Estimate:** **~10 mins**


### **Total Estimated Time:** **~2 hrs 55 mins**
Let me know once the client approves and we’ll proceed. If there’s anything in the plugin or form architecture that limits certain items, we’ll flag it immediately with recommended alternatives.

Always happy to assist.



Warmly,
**Adriane Roa**
